channel.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
channel.description:
[center][img]http://www.runetuts.com/Themes/redfox/images/custom/logo.png[/img]
[b][url=http://runetuts.com/][size=10pt]Website[/size][/url][/b] (I would appreciate if everyone joined)
So I've decided to start this project back up.
I couldn't think of anyway to explain how I'm going to do this so I decided to make a diagram.
[img]http://www.runetuts.com/files/Untitled.png[/img]
Will have a picture of the application soon.
Support this project by using one of the "I support" images below in your signature area(Even on other community's/forums)
[url=http://"http://www.runetuts.com"][img]http://www.runetuts.com/files/support.png[/img][/url] [code][url="http://www.runetuts.com" ][img]http://www.runetuts.com/files/support.png[/img][/url][/code]
[url=http://"http://www.runetuts.com"][img]http://www.runetuts.com/files/support2.png[/img][/url] [code][url="http://www.runetuts.com" ][img]http://www.runetuts.com/files/support2.png[/img][/url][/code][/center]

I started learning with deltaczar and moved on to emulous and project insanity shortly before sanity released it. I learned so many horrible practices that I still catch myself doing today
[/quote]
My story.[/quote]

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @Jaxus Jaxus
item.description:
@Jaxus wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:46, topic:528199”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646950.msg4356913#msg4356913 date=1377874225]
Vain_, that’s all the reason to put his site up and use PI. So he can get good programmers and have them write efficient PI code, that actually makes a PI run better/smoother/etc…
[/quote]adding efficiently written content to a poorly written core doesn’t help anything. it’s best to support efficient servers, because any content can be ported over to any base with a matter of renaming variables/classes/packages/constructors.

[quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=646950.msg4356899#msg4356899 date=1377872881]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=646950.msg4353614#msg4353614 date=1377091566]

Lol? It is efficient code.
[/quote]no. project insanity and delta are both highly inefficient and bad server models, and horrible oop teachings.

I personally loved Delta when I first started working with programming my own private server. I spent a few months on it, and I was at the level to move onto PI. Delta and PI are great gateway sources for new owners to the programming scene.
[/quote]not particularly. I started learning with delta and moved on to emulous and project insanity shortly before sanity released it. I learned so many horrible practices that I still catch myself doing today, as well as the servers just being horribly written.

simplicity shouldn’t be the case of the matter, whether you be new or old. you should work with efficient code.[/quote]
I don’t think anyone should worry about simplicity, although you should always try to keep things as simple as efficiency allows. Anyways, if there is one thing I have learned from using Project Insanity, well, I would be telling you a lie if I said I learned something.

Read full topic

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:45, topic:528199”]Vain_, that’s all the reason to put his site up and use PI. So he can get good programmers and have them write efficient PI code, that actually makes a PI run better/smoother/etc…[/quote]adding efficiently written content to a poorly written core doesn’t help anything. it’s best to support efficient servers, because any content can be ported over to any base with a matter of renaming variables/classes/packages/constructors.

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:44, topic:528199”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=646950.msg4353614#msg4353614 date=1377091566]

Lol? It is efficient code.
[/quote]no. project insanity and delta are both highly inefficient and bad server models, and horrible oop teachings.

I personally loved Delta when I first started working with programming my own private server. I spent a few months on it, and I was at the level to move onto PI. Delta and PI are great gateway sources for new owners to the programming scene.[/quote]not particularly. I started learning with delta and moved on to emulous and project insanity shortly before sanity released it. I learned so many horrible practices that I still catch myself doing today, as well as the servers just being horribly written.

simplicity shouldn’t be the case of the matter, whether you be new or old. you should work with efficient code.

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Mikeyzzz:

The design has picked up its game.

The down side is, that if he starts to add support for more and more revisions, the nav links will either A) be cluttered to all hell, and look nasty or B) the nav bar will have to be completely redone, making users confused as they readjust.

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:26, topic:528199”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646950.msg4351838#msg4351838 date=1376786092]

Thank you both. I’m thinking about making a control panel so I can add tutorials much faster and easier.

Good idea, what type of PHP knowledge do you have?

Little to none, I was talking to him on skype about it.
[/quote]

Ah, well @OP no need to worry, there’s tons of PHP tutorials out there, and a mostly-friendly community of people who’d love to help on Mopar. :P[/quote]Even if you come up with a sweet idea, you can pretty much google if it’s been done before, and BAM, source provided.

And everyone should stop hatin’ on PHP. I actually really like it. I’ve tried giving other languages a go, but so far I haven’t been able to get into them like I do PHP. It’s really just something I’m really familiar with.

Read full topic

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @runekeepthug runekeepthug
item.description:
@runekeepthug wrote:

Thank you all for your support, and a special thanks to sk8rdude461 for his help with everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:30, topic:528199”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=646950.msg4352080#msg4352080 date=1376833466]

Thank you both. I’m thinking about making a control panel so I can add tutorials much faster and easier.

Good idea, what type of PHP knowledge do you have?

I don’t understand why you’re continually asking people about PHP, it makes you look like an amateur, it’s like you’re expecting PHP to be on the backend of it. PHP is a fudgeing horrible language and should be burned and set on fire and exploded and maimed terribly. There are so many great web frameworks out there that you can use yet you automatically assume every site uses PHP from what I’ve seen you write on here. It’s like you’re trying to encourage the use of it, it’s an atrocious addition to the world.

@OP since you apparently have very little knowledge in the backend of things and from the code you showed me a few days back I strongly suggest reading up on the latest frontend practices and definitely not learning PHP. Take a look at Sinatra, Flask and Node. After familiarising yourself with Node take a look at Express. These are much better alternatives to PHP.
[/quote]

It’s simple, and that’s what mostly everyone uses. I suppose I could have asked for any other language/method. I was just curious to whether or not he has the knowledge to create a control panel, whatever language he chooses to use. Most people use PHP, so I figured he may.[/quote]
It isn’t what mostly everyone uses, it’s the most widely used web sided scripting language (which is because of an abundance of scripts from back in php 4 when php took over the world due to its advantages over Perl) but in no way does that mean mostly everyone. Anyone with a brain doesn’t and shouldn’t use it. Creating something like a control panel as I’m sure you know takes minimal programming knowledge so why does it matter if he has the knowledge? It would take a monkey less than a day to learn how to create a basic one.

Read full topic

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I used a jquery base for the nav bar, and threw it together in under 5 minutes. So it isn’t the best but I liked it better than what was there before. I also helped him with using correctly, and embeded the top image using css, not html.
I also removed almost all css that was in the html documents and put them on a separate sheet, because each page doesn’t need the same css over and over.

Read full topic

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:28, topic:528199”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=646950.msg4351836#msg4351836 date=1376785981]

Thank you both. I’m thinking about making a control panel so I can add tutorials much faster and easier.

Good idea, what type of PHP knowledge do you have?
[/quote]
I don’t understand why you’re continually asking people about PHP, it makes you look like an amateur, it’s like you’re expecting PHP to be on the backend of it. PHP is a fudgeing horrible language and should be burned and set on fire and exploded and maimed terribly. There are so many great web frameworks out there that you can use yet you automatically assume every site uses PHP from what I’ve seen you write on here. It’s like you’re trying to encourage the use of it, it’s an atrocious addition to the world.

@OP since you apparently have very little knowledge in the backend of things and from the code you showed me a few days back I strongly suggest reading up on the latest frontend practices and definitely not learning PHP. Take a look at Sinatra, Flask and Node. After familiarising yourself with Node take a look at Express. These are much better alternatives to PHP.[/quote]

It’s simple, and that’s what mostly everyone uses. I suppose I could have asked for any other language/method. I was just curious to whether or not he has the knowledge to create a control panel, whatever language he chooses to use. Most people use PHP, so I figured he may.

Read full topic

item.title: Runetuts - Tutorial Site [In-Development]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I don’t like how you’ve used a 1980’s design approach. I think you should fully scrap the navigation bar and focus on embedding it as part of the main content (not things like header/footer) if you understand what I mean.

Would be cool if you posted the code for us all to see.

Read full topic
